refsection.title: DESCRIPTION
refsection.para: Gets/sets view parameters in local units. The view command accepts the following subcommands:

listitem.para: Get (without arguments) or set the view center. Setting the center also changes the eye point while keeping the azimuth, elevation, and view size static.
Get (without arguments) or set the view size. Setting the view size also changes the eye point while keeping the azimuth, elevation, and center static.
Get (without arguments) or set the eye point. Setting the eye point also changes center while keeping the azimuth, elevation, and view size static.

Get (witout arguments) or set the view in the form of yaw, pitch, roll. A ypr of 0 0 0 is a rear view (AE = 180, 0). Setting the ypr also changes the azimuth, elevation, and eye point while keeping the center and view size static.
Get (witout arguments) or set the view in the form of a quarternion. Setting the quarternion also changes the azimuth, elevation, and eye point while keeping the center and view size static.

Get (without arguments) or set the azimuth, elevation, and (optional) twist. If only 2 arguments are supplied, a twist of 0 is assumed. The -i flag can be use to set the AET incrementally. Setting the azimuth and elevation also changes the eye point while keeping the center and view size static.

example.title: Set the view center at the origin of model space.
example.para: Sets the view center at the origin of model space.

example.title: Get the current yaw, pitch, and roll
example.para: Returns the yaw, pitch, and roll of the current view.

example.title: Set the current yaw, pitch, and roll
example.para: Sets the view using yaw, pitch, and roll so that the ae is 270, 0 (right).

example.title: Increase the azimuth by 10 degrees
example.para: Sets the view by increasing the current azimuth by 10 degrees
